TopicTitle: SpaceX launch -- live launch webcast begins at 3:55pm ET (April 14)

Articles.Content:
[http://www.spacex.com/webcast/](http://www.spacex.com/webcast/)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-14T19:41:02Z" title="04/14/2015 07:41  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 14, 2015</time> by steve58**
  
fixed typo
launch is aborted due to weather. 3.07 out from launch arggh!
...fudge...
damn, scrubbed because of weather ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)
Do we already have a new date? Tomorrow same time?
the commentator said around t-12 if it was aborted there is an oppurtunity tommorow. I rage quite the page after the abort so i dont know the re-sechduled date
Dangit.
Next attempt tomorrow 4:10pm EDT.
...nvm
Todays weather is supposed to be slightly worse than yesterdays.
Where is the launch taking place

> 
> Next attempt tomorrow 4:10pm EDT.

> 
> Where is the launch taking place

lol where not when.... lemme look it up

Cape Canaveral as far as I can gather.

Anyone else excited for the Falcon 9 launch today (scrubbed from yesterday)? I can't help but think of those great rocket concepts and visions of rockets from classic science fiction, evocative of the rocket ship from Tintin etc.

I find myself refreshing the Steam update page, and hoping against all common sense that I'll be celebrating the launch by starting a new 1.0 career mode game. Over-zealous-hype-train-conductors aside, it would be fun to see attempts to recreate the Falcon 9 system in Kerbal, although this might be difficult given the way craft control works. Anyway, yay for space exploration!!!

There are already mods for Falcons and Dragon capsule ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) Did you expect anything less from a very talented community full of SpaceX fanboys? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

We were watching the stream here at work yesterday when it was scrubbed, and we'll be watching again today in a couple hours ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Threads on the same subject have been merged.

Take off in about an hour and a half! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

webcast is live.
weather is clear enough to launch and it looks like it will remain that way! Lets go spaceX

...anyone know what those two four "rockets" are on the towers on each side of the Falcon 9?
